title-group.article-title: Design, Implementation and Evaluation of an Inflectional Morphology Finite-State Transducer for Irish

abstract.p: Minority languages must endeavour to keep up with language technology advances available to more dominant languages if they are to prosper in the modern world. Finite-state technology is mature, stable and robust. It is scalable and has been applied successfully in many areas of linguistic processing, notably in phonology, morphology and syntax. The design, implementation and evaluation of a morphological analyser and generator for Irish using finite-state-transducers are described. Minority languages such as Irish lack many resources (personnel, funding, linguist software), which are available to majority languages. A crucial ingredient in our approach is that it maximises re-use of existing computational and linguistic resources.
